title: Visualization of individual competency evaluations
text: Website supporting per-student formative evaluations of competencies. It includes a complete pipeline to fetch grades from teachers, and two dashboards for students and teachers.

title: WEEX √©olien
text: Server and online interface supporting a week-long teaching activity, in which students compete in groups to optimize the energy production of a wind farm. This activity is very much appreciated by students, and is often presented as a flagship of Centrale Lyon's innovation. The software is now autonomous and hosts 3 events per year.

title: Polyphony: building GUIs with ECS
text: Proof-of-concept and technical walkthrough on adapting the Entity-Component-System model to the architecture of a Graphical User Interface [IHM'18, EICS'19].

title: Turning function calls into animations
text: Demonstration of a language extension to express animations in Graphical User Interfaces, implemented in the Pharo/Smalltalk platform [EICS'17].

title: edge264
text: Experimental software decoder for the H.264 video codec, which I keep developing in my spare time to research new programming practices and to make a useful contribution to the open source community.

title: Exploring the design of compiler feedback
text: Three visual prototypes of an IDE interface with a richer communication with compilers, along with an exhaustive list of cases where they could be useful [PPIG'12].

title: Algorithms and data structures
text: complexity, sorting, graphs, dynamic programming, Python

title: Object-oriented design and programming
text: introduction to Software Engineering, UML, OOP, Graphical User Interfaces (slides, support), Python/tkinter

title: Web application project
text: client-server architecture, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, Python, SQLite, team working, git

title: Computer science specialty project
text: 4 students working on the initial teacher visualizations for the competency website

title: Competitive programming project
text: 6 students competing during a year for their school at CodinGame (4th/410) and other challenges. I gave a custom course to help them progress faster. With this motivated group Centrale Lyon also reached the 1st rank in France on Kattis, and the leader also ran a programming club for all students.

title: Student mentoring
text: counseling 3 students throughout their first year at Centrale Lyon

title: Internship
text: Pierre Baron worked on refining the visualizations for the competency website and creating a full initial version. He did a great job!

title: Computer science specialty project
text: 4 last-year students creating the initial student visualizations for the competency website.

title: Applied research project
text: 2 students worked during a year on a proof-of-concept of automatic graph visualization for teaching and presented it at EIAH'21.

title: Campus mobility project
role: co-supervisor with Olivier Bareille and C√©cile Lacoin
text: 5 students planned a survey and a Mobility Day during a year to try to reduce the number of solo drivers on the campus. I volunteered and helped mainly with the survey.

title: Competitive programming project
text: 6 students competing for their school at SWERC (82th/95), Hash Code (3181th/10724), BattleDev (315th/4935), and reaching round 1 at Code Jam. After SWERC I created a custom competitive programming course to help them progress faster.

title: Introduction to human-machine interfaces
text: programming Graphical User Interfaces with JavaFX, event-based programming, user interface mockups, usability evaluation and heuristics

title: Advanced algorithms
text: recursive and iterative algorithms, recursive and advanced data structures

title: Introduction to computer systems
text: coding numbers and text, computer architecture, operating systems, scripting and the terminal, processes and files

title: Web technologies
text: client-side Web technologies HTML/CSS/JavaScript

title: Algorithms and complexity
text: divide and conquer, dynamic programming, greedy algorithms, complexity analysis, P/NP and reduction
Reviewer for CHI'22 and EICS'22

Member of the Sustainable Development and Societal Responsibility local committee from September 2021. We mainly worked on applying the recommendations from COP 2 that was recently signed by the director of Centrale Lyon.
Reviewer for CHI'21 and IHM'20'21
Reviewer for CHI'20
Reviewer for IHM'19

Reviewer for IWST'17 and ManLang'17

title: Hash Code 2022 contest
text: 703th/10177, 52th/529 in France, team #import mercy on my own.

title: Creative and competitive programming club
text: I ran this club for students from February to April, with sessions alternating between competitive programming and live music coding with FoxDot.

title: Lost Souls Found The Gold You Lost To Save Your Soul
text: Pacman-like game created with Cl√©ment Pillias and Nicole Pong for the Global Game Jam 2021. I did the UI, level design and music (although due to a bug you rarely hear the full version).

title: Advent of Code 2020
text: This year I went through all the puzzles of this Christmas-themed challenge.

title: Code Jam 2020 contest
text: Reaching round 3 of this challenging competition.

title: Hash Code 2020 contest
text: 2826th/10724, 2nd in our hub, team XoXot with Damien Masson, Nicolas Crosetti and Paul Gallot.

title: Online IDE with supervision
text: Online IDE including a Python interpreter, that I coded at the start of the Covid outbreak to allow students to ask for help and show their code remotely (viewed as a mosaic on my side). It lacked modules so students would only use it to show code, but it was super helpful to let them feel supported throughout this event.

title: Competitive programming course
text: Slides for a custom course I created for 6 students, based on the excellent Competitive Programming 3 book.

title: MOOC on university teaching (French)
text: Followed during 10 weeks for ~2h/week [Certificate of completion]

title: SWERC 2020
text: My very first participation, as a coach, with teams ECL 1 (82th/98) and ECL 2 (84th/98). I also scored well at the coaches contest.

title: Mise en place d‚Äôune plateforme de programmation comp√©titive comme support de TDs (French)
text: Workshop given on 5 February during the colloquium Didapro 8, to present the setup and use of DMOJ for automated grading.

title: Raid Centrale Lyon
text: Running, cycling and canoeing. We registered for the discovery level with Thierry Gonon and finished 3<sup>rd</sup>.

title: Hash Code 2019 contest
text: 91th/6671, 6th in France, team Lokidoki on my own.

title: Catalysts Coding Contest
text: Team //#include <mercy> with Lucien Mousin, 2nd in Lille, for which I participated in organizing the hub.

title: Hash Code 2018 contest
text: 1122th/3012, team //#include <mercy> with Lucien Mousin.

title: Demonstrating animations in Pharo Smalltalk
text: Presentation given on 19 May during Pharo Days in Lille, France.

title: Catalysts Coding Contest
text: Team ThiYo with Yoann Dufresne, 3rd in Lille, where I also helped organizing the hub (printing T-shirts and communicating to students).

title: Hash Code 2017 contest
text: 186th/2815, 1st in our hub, team ThiYo with Yoann Dufresne.

title: Meilleur jeu du monde
text: Nerds + Beers = Game dev party... (during FOSDEM 2017)

title: Bamboo that bends
text: A 3D Twister game made with five people during the ZooMachines Interactive Arts festival, which was way funnier than on video!

title: Early ECS demonstration in Pharo Smalltalk
text: Presentation given on 25 August at ESUG 2016, Prague, Czech Republic.

title: A case about parsing errors
text: A blog article about the handling of errors in edge264.

title: Hash Code 2016 contest
text: 153rd/1054, 1st in our hub, team Brony Express with Izzatbek Mukhanov and S√©bastien Poulmane.

title: The Maze Nightmare
text: Short game created with Yoann Dufresne and Matthieu Falce for the Ludum Dare Jam 35. As usual I did the artwork and music. Beware the game is meant to be oppressing...

title: Little Sheep
text: Short story-telling game created with Alexandre Kohen during 3 days for the Ludum Dare Jam 23. I did the artwork and music :)

title: Assisting interface for easy administration of a CMS
text: Study of a novel interface for online Content Management Systems, for the Interaction Design course. [PDF]

title: Assassination Game Application
text: Video prototype for a Group Project of the Interaction Design course.

title: WHILE compiler
text: Optimizing compiler backend written in Java for a subset of the WHILE language to UNIX x64 assembly, for the Program Semantics and Analysis course. [sample output]

title: Diffusion en direct avec VLC (French)
text: Interactive tutorial to easily set up a high-quality real-time video broadcast using VLC.

title: Mise en place de VOD (French)
text: Step-by-step documentation to install and fine-tune a Video-on-Demand server on Linux.

title: Club programmation
text: Support material for an OpenGL course I created at Centrale Marseille.

title: Film de Rentr√©e du GInfo (French)
text: Short movie promoting the Computer Science student association at the annual associations fair of Ecole Centrale Marseille. A must-watch if you've scrolled down this far :)

title: Compression avec StaxRip (French)
text: Tutorial to compress a video exported by Premiere Pro, using the software StaxRip. The parameters would correct the flaws introduced by Premiere (its disastrous deinterlacing filter) and output in a format ready for integration in a Web player.

title: Compression avec MeGUI (French)
text: Tutorial to compress a video exported by Premiere Pro, using MeGUI. It was soon superseeded by the tutorial on StaxRip.

title: La lentille √©lectrostatique (French comments)
text: Simultation of an electrostatic lens by shooting electrons in a simple finite element mesh, created for the TIPE exam at the end of the Classes Pr√©paratoires.

title: Mod√®le EXE (French comments)
text: Source code for nasm based on the PE/COFF reference, to create an executable file from scratch without linking.

title: Oscillations d'un Fil (French comments)
text: Real-time simulation of a flexible wire using Lagrangian Mechanics and RK4 integration, created for the TIPE exam.

title: Casse-briques (French comments)
text: Breakout-clone where the paddle can tilt.

title: Visionneuse 3D (French)
text: Interactive viewer for 3D objects stored in files. This program ended a 3-year obsession to create a 3D engine, and was my last BASIC program before playing with more modern languages.
